segment.source: Monitor resource attribute definitions (Windows 10)
segment.target: Monitor resource attribute definitions (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to resource attribute definitions when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to resource attribute definitions when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor resource attribute definitions
segment.target: Monitor resource attribute definitions

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to resource attribute definitions when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to resource attribute definitions when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Resource attribute definitions define the basic properties of resource attributes, such as what it means for a resource to be defined as “high business value.”
segment.target: Resource attribute definitions define the basic properties of resource attributes, such as what it means for a resource to be defined as “high business value.”

segment.source: Resource attribute definitions are stored in AD DS under the Resource Properties container.
segment.target: Resource attribute definitions are stored in AD DS under the Resource Properties container.

segment.source: Changes to these definitions could significantly change the protections that govern a resource, even if the resource attributes that apply to the resource remain unchanged.
segment.target: Changes to these definitions could significantly change the protections that govern a resource, even if the resource attributes that apply to the resource remain unchanged.

segment.source: Changes can be monitored like any other AD DS object.
segment.target: Changes can be monitored like any other AD DS object.

segment.source: For information about monitoring changes to the resource attributes that apply to files, see Monitor the resource attributes on files and folders.
segment.target: For information about monitoring changes to the resource attributes that apply to files, see Monitor the resource attributes on files and folders.

segment.source: Use the following procedures to configure settings to monitor changes to resource attribute definitions in AD DS and to verify the changes.
segment.target: Use the following procedures to configure settings to monitor changes to resource attribute definitions in AD DS and to verify the changes.

segment.source: These procedures assume that you have configured and deployed Dynamic Access Control, including central access policies, claims, and other components, in your network.
segment.target: These procedures assume that you have configured and deployed Dynamic Access Control, including central access policies, claims, and other components, in your network.

segment.source: If you have not yet deployed Dynamic Access Control in your network, see Deploy a Central Access Policy (Demonstration Steps).
segment.target: If you have not yet deployed Dynamic Access Control in your network, see Deploy a Central Access Policy (Demonstration Steps).

segment.source: Note: Your server might function differently based on the version and edition of the operating system that is installed, your account permissions, and your menu settings.
segment.target: Note: Your server might function differently based on the version and edition of the operating system that is installed, your account permissions, and your menu settings.

segment.source: To configure settings to monitor changes to resource attributes
segment.target: To configure settings to monitor changes to resource attributes

segment.source: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.
segment.target: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.

segment.source: In Server Manager, point to Tools, and then click Group Policy Management.
segment.target: In Server Manager, point to Tools, and then click Group Policy Management.

segment.source: In the console tree, right-click the Group Policy Object for the default domain controller, and then click Edit.
segment.target: In the console tree, right-click the Group Policy Object for the default domain controller, and then click Edit.

segment.source: Double-click Computer Configuration, click Security Settings, expand Advanced Audit Policy Configuration, expand System Audit Policies, click DS Access, and then double-click Audit directory service changes.
segment.target: Double-click Computer Configuration, click Security Settings, expand Advanced Audit Policy Configuration, expand System Audit Policies, click DS Access, and then double-click Audit directory service changes.

segment.source: Select the Configure the following audit events check box, select the Success check box (and the Failure check box, if desired), and then click OK.
segment.target: Select the Configure the following audit events check box, select the Success check box (and the Failure check box, if desired), and then click OK.

segment.source: Close the Group Policy Management Editor.
segment.target: Close the Group Policy Management Editor.

segment.source: Open the Active Directory Administrative Center.
segment.target: Open the Active Directory Administrative Center.

segment.source: Under Dynamic Access Control, right-click Resource Properties, and then click Properties.
segment.target: Under Dynamic Access Control, right-click Resource Properties, and then click Properties.

segment.source: Click the Security tab, click Advanced to open the Advanced Security Settings dialog box, and then click the Auditing tab.
segment.target: Click the Security tab, click Advanced to open the Advanced Security Settings dialog box, and then click the Auditing tab.

segment.source: Click Add, add a security auditing setting for the container, and then close all Security properties dialog boxes.
segment.target: Click Add, add a security auditing setting for the container, and then close all Security properties dialog boxes.

segment.source: After you configure settings to monitor changes to resource attributes in AD DS, verify that the changes are being monitored.
segment.target: After you configure settings to monitor changes to resource attributes in AD DS, verify that the changes are being monitored.

segment.source: To verify that changes to resource definitions are monitored
segment.target: To verify that changes to resource definitions are monitored

segment.source: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.
segment.target: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.

segment.source: Open the Active Directory Administrative Center.
segment.target: Open the Active Directory Administrative Center.

segment.source: Under Dynamic Access Control, click Resource Properties, and then double-click a resource attribute.
segment.target: Under Dynamic Access Control, click Resource Properties, and then double-click a resource attribute.

segment.source: Make changes to this resource attribute.
segment.target: Make changes to this resource attribute.

segment.source: Click OK, and then close the Active Directory Administrative Center.
segment.target: Click OK, and then close the Active Directory Administrative Center.

segment.source: In Server Manager, click Tools, and then click Event Viewer.
segment.target: In Server Manager, click Tools, and then click Event Viewer.

segment.source: Expand Windows Logs, and then click Security.
segment.target: Expand Windows Logs, and then click Security.

segment.source: Verify that event 5137 appears in the security log.
segment.target: Verify that event 5137 appears in the security log.

segment.source: Related resource
segment.target: Related resource

segment.source: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
segment.target: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
